registry.description: The Docker registry to pull the image from

repository.description: The registry repository to pull the image from

pullSecrets.description: A list of secrets to use for pulling images from private registries

kind.description: The kind of workload to deploy Vaultwarden as (`StatefulSet` or `Deployment`)

domain.description: The domain of the Vaultwarden installation

enabled.description: Whether or not to enable the Vaultwarden Web UI - enabled by default

folder.description: A custom folder from which to load assets for the Web UI - defaults to 'web-vault/'

allowSends.description: Controls whether users are allowed to create Bitwarden Sends. Applies globally to all users.

allowEmergencyAccess.description: Controls whether users can enable emergency access to their accounts. Applies globally to all users.

allowEmailChange.description: Controls whether users can change their email. Applies globally to all users.

enableOrgEvents.description: Controls whether event logging is enabled for organizations. Applies to organizations.

retainEventsDays.description: Number of days to retain events stored in the database.

ipHeader.description: The Client IP Header, defaults to "X-Forwarded-For".

orgCreationUsers.description: Controls which users can create new orgs.

enableOrgGroups.description: Controls whether group support is enabled for organizations

value.description: The value for the Vaultwarden admin token

disable.description: Disable token authentication for the admin panel

name.description: The name of an existing Secret containing the admin token

key.description: The key name within the previously named existingSecret

rootPath.description: The data folder is used for all files by default

rsaKey.description: The file path for the RSA key, 'data/rsa_key' by default

iconCache.description: The path for icon cache, 'data/icon_cache' by default

attachments.description: The mail attachments path, 'data/attachments' by default

sends.description: The mail sends path, 'data/sends' by default

tmp.description: The temporary data path, 'data/tmp' by default

size.description: The size given to PVCs created from the above data

storageClass.description: The storageClass given to PVCs created from the above data

reclaimPolicy.description: The resourcePolicy given to PVCs created from the above data

existingClaim.description: Provide the name to an existing PVC

attemptsLimit.description: Maximum attempts before an email token is reset requiring a new email

from.description: The from-address for emails sent by Vaultwarden

fromName.description: The from-name for emails sent by Vaultwarden

auth.description: Defaults for SSL is "Plain" and "Login" and nothing for Non-SSL connections.

name.description: The name of an existing BasicAuth secret

enabled.description: Whether or not to use sendmail for sending emails

path.description: The path to which sendmail binary to use.

heloName.description: Server name sent during the SMTP HELO

enforceInviteVerification.description: Setup email 2FA regardless of any organization policy

autoFallback.description: Automatically setup email 2FA as fallback provider when needed

enabled.description: Whether to enable Websocket push notifications

type.description: Choose the database type. Can be 'sqlite' or (external) 'mysql'/'postgresql'

user.description: Provide the username to the (external) Vaultwarden database - ignored if the database type is 'sqlite'

password.description: Provide the password to the (external) Vaultwarden database - ignored if the database type is 'sqlite'

host.description: Provide the host to the (external) Vaultwarden database - ignored if the database type is 'sqlite'

port.description: Provide the port to the (external) Vaultwarden database - ignored if the database type is 'sqlite'

name.description: Provide the name to the (external) Vaultwarden database - ignored if the database type is 'sqlite'

uri.description: Manually provide the entire URI to the (external) Vaultwarden database - ignored if the database type is 'sqlite'

name.description: The name of an existing secret

key.description: The key within the existing secret

ratelimitSeconds.description: Number of seconds between login requests

ratelimitMaxBurst.description: Allow bursts of requests up to this amount

adminRatelimitSeconds.description: Number of seconds between admin login requests

adminRatelimitMaxBurst.description: Allow bursts of admin requests up to this amount

adminSessionLifetime.description: The lifetime of an admin session

showHint.description: Show hints directly on login page - disabled by default

allowed.description: Whether or not new users can register

verify.description: Whether email verification is need to sign up

verifyResendTime.description: How many seconds to wait to resend a verification email

verifyResendLimit.description: How many verificatione mails will be sent in total

domainWhitelist.description: A comma-separated list of domains which can always register

incomplete2FATimeLimit.description: Minutes to wait before a 2FA login is considere incomplete

enable.description: Whether to enable authentication via YubiKeys
Whether to enable authentication via Duo

allowed.description: Invitations org admins to invite users, even when signups are disabled

expirationHours.description: Number of hours which an email invitation lasts

relayUri.description: Set a custom relay URI for push notifications

identityUri.description: Set a custom identity URI for push notifications

name.description: The name of an existing Secret containing the HIBP API key

key.description: The key within an existing Secret which contains the key

pollIntervalMS.description: The poll interval for the job schedular in milliseconds

sendPurgeSchedule.description: Cron schedule to purge outdated Bitwarden Sends

trashPurgeSchedule.description: Cron schedule to purge trashed items

incomplete2FASchedule.description: Cron schedule to check for incomplete 2FA logins

emergencyRequestTimeout.description: Cron schedule for emergency access requests

trashAutoDeleteDays.description: Number of days to wait before auto-deleting a trashed item.

timestampFormat.description: Timestamp format used in extended logging.

folder.description: Templates data folder, by default embedded templates are used

reload.description: Automatically reload the templates for every request

service.description: Which service to use for fetching icons

redirectCode.description: The HTTP code to use for redirects to external services

blacklistNonGlobalIPs.description: Any IP which is not defined as a global IP will be blacklisted.

ttl.description: Cache time-to-live for successfully obtained icons, in seconds

negttl.description: Cache time-to-live for icons which weren't available, in seconds

address.description: The address Rocket should bind to

port.description: The port rocket should bind to

workers.description: The amount of rocket workers to create

featureFlags.description: A list of feature flags to enable

labels.description: Extra Labels for the ConfigMap resource

annotations.description: Common annotations for the SMTP, HIBP, Admin and Database secrets

labels.description: Common extra labels for the SMTP, HIBP, Admin and Database secrets

className.description: The IngressClass to use for the pod's ingress

whitelist.description: A comma-separated list of IP addresses to whitelist

tls.description: A list of hostnames and secret names to use for TLS

extraHosts.description: A list of extra hosts for the Ingress resource (with vaultwarden.domain)

type.description: The type of service to create

port.description: The port to use on the service

nodePort.description: The Node port to use on the service

extraPorts.description: Extra ports to add to the service

externalTrafficPolicy.description: The external traffic policy for the service

internalTrafficPolicy.description: The internal traffic policy for the service

clusterIP.description: Define a static cluster IP for the service

loadBalancerClass.description: Define Load Balancer class if service type is `LoadBalancer` (optional, cloud specific)

sessionAffinity.description: Session Affinity for Kubernetes service, can be "None" or "ClientIP"

rules.description: Extra rules to add to the Role

create.description: Whether a service account should be created

automount.description: Whether to automount the service account token

annotations.description: Annotations to add to the service account

name.description: A custom name for the service account, otherwise vaultwarden.fullname is used

secrets.description: A list of secrets mountable by this service account

enabled.description: Enable or disable the use of liveness probes

initialDelaySeconds.description: Configure the initial delay seconds for the liveness probe

timeoutSeconds.description: Configure the initial delay seconds for the liveness probe

periodSeconds.description: Configure the seconds for each period of the liveness probe

successThreshold.description: Configure the success threshold for the liveness probe

failureThreshold.description: Configure the failure threshold for the liveness probe

enabled.description: Enable or disable the use of readiness probes

initialDelaySeconds.description: Configure the initial delay seconds for the readiness probe

timeoutSeconds.description: Configure the initial delay seconds for the readiness probe

periodSeconds.description: Configure the seconds for each period of the readiness probe

successThreshold.description: Configure the success threshold for the readiness probe

failureThreshold.description: Configure the failure threshold for the readiness probe

enabled.description: Enable or disable the use of readiness probes

initialDelaySeconds.description: Configure the initial delay seconds for the startup probe

timeoutSeconds.description: Configure the initial delay seconds for the startup probe

periodSeconds.description: Configure the seconds for each period of the startup probe

successThreshold.description: Configure the success threshold for the startup probe

failureThreshold.description: Configure the failure threshold for the startup probe

minAvailable.description: The minium amount of pods which need to be available

resources.description: The resource limits/requests for the Vaultwarden pod

initContainers.description: Define initContainers for the main Vaultwarden server

strategy.description: Specify a deployment strategy for the Vaultwarden pod

podAnnotations.description: Extra annotations for the Vaultwarden pod

podLabels.description: Extra labels for the Vaultwarden pod

priorityClassName.description: The name of an existing PriorityClass

podSecurityContext.description: Security context settings for the Vaultwarden pod
